intro: Pentapogon scaberulus, commonly known as the rough-leaved pentapogon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often in woodland or meadow habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive pubescent surface. It is primarily found in parts of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in shaded or semi-shaded conditions.
